name: unidmrn

stmt.pretty: eqtr4i(⋃ ⋃ `' c0, (dom(c0)⋃ ran(c0)), (ran(`' c0)⋃ dom(`' c0)))

stmt.pretty: uneq12i(dom(c0), ran(c0), ran(`' c0), dom(`' c0))

body.origin:
|- wceq(cun(cdm(c0), crn(c0)), cun(crn(ccnv(c0)), cdm(ccnv(c0))))
-| wceq(cdm(c0), crn(ccnv(c0)))
-| wceq(crn(c0), cdm(ccnv(c0)))
body.pretty:
⊢ (dom(c0)⋃ ran(c0))=(ran(`' c0)⋃ dom(`' c0))
⊣ dom(c0)= ran(`' c0)
⊣ ran(c0)= dom(`' c0)

cumulated.origin:
|- wceq(cuni(cuni(ccnv(c0))), cun(cdm(c0), crn(c0)))
-| wceq(cdm(c0), crn(ccnv(c0)))
-| wceq(crn(c0), cdm(ccnv(c0)))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ ⋃ ⋃ `' c0 =(dom(c0)⋃ ran(c0))
⊣ dom(c0)= ran(`' c0)
⊣ ran(c0)= dom(`' c0)

comment: The double union of the converse of a class is its field. (Contributed by NM, 4-Jun-2008.)
